That which is posited ...
The illuminated nature then disappears.
Then it's the original awareness of the essence of consciousness.
It's able to give rise to cognition and its objects.
What's left by the cognition is the cognition that's produced.
They simply follow the marks of the cognition that has cognition.
It's really only the nature of consciousness.
It's unified with what's produced by both subject and object.
It's like when the wind moves water.
Waves continue to flow.
The nature of clarity is completely hidden.
It's hidden and doesn't appear.
From this delusion.
...gives rise to the nature of emptiness.
Again, it's because of space.
It creates the shape of the world.
In the vacuum and single mind, there's no sameness or difference after all.
After all, there's no sameness or difference.
It's blazingly established.
It creates the ultimate difference between all dharmas.
It's all because of the disturbance of emotions and perceptions.
It causes the worldly dust to arise.

source_sentence: 迷妄昏沈引起虛空之界。
translation: Delusion and confusion give rise to the realm of space.
They distinguish distinctions in the world as different and establish the purity of space as the same.
They posit the purity of space as the same.
Within the discriminating consciousness, it's also established that there's no sameness and no difference.
It's also posited that there's neither sameness nor difference.
They're all existential phenomena.
They all form the conditions of arising and ceasing.
They don't fully understand the origin.
It's ultimately a conceptual argument.
Record of the Axiom Mirror, Volume 77

source_sentence: 戊申歲分司大藏都監開板
translation: Eshinsei yoseido dazangdu jieban
